heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5433 lux) and cloud levels (up 893 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5120 lux) and cloud levels (up 490 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 893.5m lower than yesterday, 490.0m lower than the past week, 131.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1078m to 4940m and averaged 1596.3m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The sun is below the horizon, it is probably not the optimal time to be hanging out your washing.
